creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: six thick glass slabs electrically illuminated from within and supported by an inverted u-shaped chromed tubing set into a glass plint base
image_copyright: Copyright of the artist%2C artist%27s estate%2C or assignees
text: Though Kuykens is a bit of a mystery, this lamp is an example of the stacked rectangular planes of color—here strikingly expressed in glass, acting as reflectors for the bulb—that characterize Dutch design of this period.
title: Floor lamp
